title: Barry Hughes
text:
Barry Hughes (31 December 1937 – 2 June 2019) was a Welsh professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and manager, active primarily in the Netherlands. He played as a <a href="defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Early and personal life.
Hughes was born in <a href="Caernarfon">Caernarfon</a>. He attended <a href="Glyndwr%20Secondary%20Modern%20school">Glyndwr Secondary Modern school</a>. In 1965 he married Elles Berger, a Dutch TV personality. The couple had three daughters and six grandchildren.
Playing career.
Hughes began his career with the youth team of English team <a href="West%20Bromwich%20Albion%20F.C.">West Bromwich Albion</a>, but left after six years, without making a first-team appearance in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a>. He played in the Netherlands for <a href="Blauw-Wit%20Amsterdam">Blauw-Wit</a>, from 1960 to 1963, and for <a href="AZ%20%28football%20club%29">Alkmaar'54</a> from 1963 to 1965. He was captain of Alkmaar.
Coaching career.
After retiring as a player, Hughes began his coaching career in 1965 with <a href="AZ%20%28football%20club%29">Alkmaar'54</a>. He later managed a variety of Dutch club sides including <a href="HFC%20Haarlem">HFC Haarlem</a>, <a href="Go%20Ahead%20Eagles">Go Ahead Eagles</a>, <a href="Sparta%20Rotterdam">Sparta Rotterdam</a>, <a href="FC%20Utrecht">FC Utrecht</a>, <a href="MVV">MVV</a> and <a href="FC%20Volendam">FC Volendam</a>. While managing Haarlem in 1978, Hughes signed young player <a href="Ruud%20Gullit">Ruud Gullit</a> to his first ever professional football contract.
Music career.
Hughes released a 7" music single in 1978 called ""Voetbal is Koning" (Football is king).
In 1981, he released another single together with "De Kwaffeurs". The song is called "Ik wil op mijn kop een kamerbreed tapijt"" ("I want on my head a wall to wall carpet"), a carnival song referencing his baldness. It was in the Dutch top 40 for eight weeks, where it reached place 7 between week 7 and 8 in 1981.
Death.
Hughes died in Amsterdam on 2 June 2019, aged 81.
